tweet_text: @andrewcdole @Riggstrades @carloss86123360 @LadeBackk I don't think you and I are in disagreement. We're just saying it differently. You have to remember the key is realized gains/losses, and then apply the wash sale rule. As long as the loss does not trigger the wash sale rule then yes, it can be used a loss, and is tax deductible.
text_en: I don't think you and I are in disagreement. We're just saying it differently. You have to remember the key is realized gains/losses, and then apply the wash sale rule. As long as the loss does not trigger the wash sale rule then yes, it can be used a loss, and is tax deductible.
reply_text: I don't think you and I are in disagreement. We're just saying it differently. You have to remember the key is realized gains/losses, and then apply the wash sale rule. As long as the loss does not trigger the wash sale rule then yes, it can be used a loss, and is tax deductible.
